summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 12, 2019. It details routine institutional operations, staff assignments, inmate movements, and administrative data. The report is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death there in August 2019.

events.title: Daily Activity at MCC New York
events.description: Routine operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including a discovered hole in the exterior, an immediate use of force on an inmate, an inmate failing to return from furlough, several inmates placed in SHU pending investigation, staff shortages, and inmate admissions/releases.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This is a routine daily activity report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York dated July 13, 2019, documenting activities from July 12, 2019.
The report notes a 'hole discovered uncovered institution's exterior leading into unknown Facility shop/space', indicating a potential security breach.
An 'Immediate Use of Force' was conducted on inmate Grayson (#70887-054).
The facility was experiencing a shortage of staff, leading to vacated correctional assignments.
The report provides a total inmate population of 801 at the beginning of the morning watch on July 12, 2019.
